intro: Spermacoce huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén cuchufli, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Spermacoce huillensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
